item.title: Magnetic resonance - Rabi's oscillation
item.description: The system of Rabi oscillation # Neutral atom with spin 1/2 is immersed in the magnetic field of $\vec{B} = B_0 \hat{z}+B_1\left( \cos(\omega t)\hat{x}+\sin(\omega t)\hat{y}\right)$ where the magnetic field is rotating anti-clockwise with respect to z axis with angular frequency $\omega$. The the magnetic moment of the atom is, $$\begin{equation} \hat{\mu} = \frac{e}{m}\hat{S} = \frac{e}{m}\frac{\hbar}{2}\hat{\sigma} \end{equation}$$ The Hamiltonian of the system is then, $$\begin{equation} \hat{H} = -\hat{\mu}\cdot\hat{B} = \frac{\hbar}{2} \begin{pmatrix} \Omega_0 & \Omega_1 e^{-i\omega t} \\ \Omega_1 e^{i\omega t} & -\Omega_0\end{pmatrix} \end{equation}$$

item.title: Visualization of Phonons
item.description: Classical representation of lattice vibration # Phonon is a quasi particle which the number of phonons in the system corresponds to the quantum excitation of vibration. This concept of particle and quantization of excitation of vibration is from quantum mechanics and quantum field theory. This concept of phonon help us understand the underlying physics of specific heat capacity of solids. However, I was surprised how the concept of phonon could just as well be derived classically from Newtons law of motion $F=ma$.
